definition: to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order

sentences.english: He reordered two pairs of black leather shoes of the latest type.
sentences.chinese: 他又订购了两双最新式的黑皮鞋。

sentences.english: If you desire full redundancy, order option 002.
sentences.chinese: 如果需要完全冗余，则订购选项002。

sentences.english: If you’d rather not miss out, click here to buy the EBK now.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不想错过这次机会，请点击这里订购。

sentences.english: Beautiful and delicacy glass-yarn lace, welcome to inquiry.
sentences.chinese: 精美玻璃纱花边，欢迎订购。

sentences.english: Assume you are tasked to implement a book ordering process.
sentences.chinese: 假设分派您的任务是实现图书订购流程。

sentences.english: They an order 25 of glasses that shop.
sentences.chinese: 他们向那家店订购了二十五副眼镜。

sentences.english: What most is exasperating , I order this model of new car, already suspended production at present.
sentences.chinese: 最气人的是，我订购的这款新车，目前已经停产。

sentences.english: If you accept our counter-offer, we'll persuade the customers to place an order with you.
sentences.chinese: 如果你方接受我方还盘，我们将劝客户向你方订购。

sentences.english: The ordering lot-sizing problem of multi-items under fuzzy constraints.
sentences.chinese: 模糊约束下的多物品订购问题。

sentences.english: I recently ordered Internet and phone service from the cable company.
sentences.chinese: 我最近从电信公司订购了互联网和电话服务。

sentences.english: We are delighted with your products and are thinking of placing an order.
sentences.chinese: 我们对你方的产物很是对劲，正欲订购。
订购硬拷贝手册的链接。

sentences.english: The ordering lot-sizing problem of single item under fuzzy demand condition.
sentences.chinese: 需求模糊情况下的单物品订购问题。

sentences.english: Users can also get a report on all items that they have ordered in the past.
sentences.chinese: 用户还能够得到他们过去已订购的所有货品的报告。

sentences.english: The guy who insists on ordering a whole case of extra glasses to handle the overflow.
sentences.chinese: 我会坚持另外订购一柜子的杯子，防止水满得装不下。

sentences.english: C. Purchasing's knowledge of requisitioner ordering habits and patters.
sentences.chinese: 采购部门了解需求者的订购习惯和行话。

definition: to order goods/to place an order
to procure (for an enterprise etc)/to purchase
to order goods/to place an order
to place an order/to book ahead
to sell/to offer for sale/to put on the market
